title: Relates to a victim's rights to parole information
summary: Relates to the rights of a crime victim; provides that if parole is granted, the reasons for granting parole must be stated in detail in writing; allows a victim access to such information and to transcripts of all interviews conducted; requires the district attorney to notify the victim of their right to be present at proceedings and to provide an oral/written statement at such proceedings; further provides the victim the opportunity to present their views to the same member of the board who conducts the interview with the inmate.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law and the executive law, in relation to the rights of a crime victim at parole proceedings
